message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the task of learning novel visual concepts from sentence descriptions of images, which involves computer vision (CV) and natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CV and cs.CL are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a method based on machine learning (ML) techniques such as m-RNN and weight sharing, which makes cs.LG a likely sub-category. The paper also deals with preventing overfitting, which is a common problem in ML, making cs.AI a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes novel concept datasets, which could be of interest to researchers in information retrieval (IR), making cs.IR a possible sub-category.
